page.title: 08FARMS NEAR PETERSFIELD 3
page.content:
{Downgate}farm is a free-range chicken farm. Mr. Coots has about 40 acres of grassland. He has about 7000 chickens and his main business is selling eggs. He also keeps a few sheep. When the chickens are too old for laying eggs they are taken to a chicken factory and killed to be used for making chicken pies and chicken soup.
{Ridge}farm is a beef-producing farm of 63 acres. It has 30 steers. The farmer feeds his animals twice a day. They have cattle nuts in winter and in summer grass. In winter they sleep inside. When they are old enough they go to the slaughter house.
